CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 24, 1957, pg. A12 reads: "Dr. Hopson Entertains - Dr. James Hopson, Talladaga College professor, whose home is in Pittsburgh ,gave his annual cocktail party-supper and program Saturday at the home of his sister and brother-in-law, the Nathaniel Dandridges. Here are a few of the out-of-town guests.  Seated: Mrs. Bali Schalk Early of Detroit; Mrs. Thelma Danforth, Cleveland, and Mrs. Gladys Curtis of Philadelphia.  Standing: Atty. Lawrence Carroll of Chicago, and Loften Mitchell, New York playwright. - Teenie Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left, seated: Bali Schalk Early, Thelma Danforth, and Gladys Curtis; standing: Atty. Lawrence Carroll and playwright Loften Mitchell, gathered for cocktail party in home of Nathaniel and Helen Dandridge
